The Saatto are a honorable and prideful society. They dwell upon the
Dragon's Isle said to be the home of the ferciest dragon to ever live, known
to the Saatto as Ferrutu or Deathwing in the human tongue. Few people in the
early times dared to venture to Dragon's Isle, and of the few that did many
did not return. The handful of people that did make it back alive told
strange tales of the three eyed swordsmen. Eventually after Deathwing seemed
to disappear from the lands of Akrios trade routes were set up between the
Island and the mainlands. The Saatto began to explore and they even began to
migrate off of their island. Most races have a healthy respect for the
Saatto people and their culture as they hold their honor to be the most
precious of things. They are a honest and prideful people and demand respect
while at the same time giving it back. They are a gangly race, thin with
very long arms and legs. Even their hands and fingers are longer than any
humans. Although they appear to be clumsy in appearance, nothing could be
farther from the truth. Their agility far exceeds any other race, even the
elves who were thought to be the most agile for long years before the Saatto
were discovered. The Saatto have mastered the sword, developing new and
unusual techniques that are mesmerizig to watch and make full use of their
agility in place of strength in which they lack somewhat. They also have a
third eye centered within their forehead that allows them to see things that
most others do not. They are a very enlightened people and have mastered the
arts of psionics and are very capable with magik which they do not shun as
the humans do because of the Great Loss. The Saatto are very pale and have
blonde, white, or on rare occasion black hair. Their eyes are generally
blue, green, or golden yellow. They range in height from 6'0" to 7'0". They
are a quiet and solemn people, slow to anger. Once you have lost their
respect it is hard to regain it. They are considered great traveling
companions and more than helpful in a fight.
